etymology.description: Phonetic: 雚 (guān, 'cry of waterfowl') + Semantic: 見 (jiàn, 'see') = depiction of sight -> observe
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the notion of seeing (見) with the sound associated with waterfowl (雚), creating an association with attentive observation, akin to watching birds.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 觀: 雚 was simplified to 又 and 見 was simplified to 见, keeping the main phonetic concept while simplifying the brush strokes.

examples.chinese: 他观星(他觀星)，寻找宇宙秘密(尋找宇宙祕密)。
examples.pinyin: tā guān xīng, xúnzhǎo yǔzhòu mìmì.
examples.english: He observes the stars and seeks the secrets of the universe.

examples.chinese: 我们观剧(我們觀劇)，品味精彩情节(品味精彩情節)。
examples.pinyin: wǒmen guān jù, pǐnwèi jīngcǎi qíngjié.
examples.english: We watch the play and savor its brilliant plot.
